Package bauernhof.preset

Class Logger

  • java.lang.Object
    • bauernhof.preset.Logger
  • public class Logger
extends Object
    A simple logger for creating fancy log outputs.

    One of the first things your program should do is to initialize this logger using setMaxLogLevel(LogLevel).

    You can log messages using the many debug, info, warn, and error functions.
    The output format and degree of information will depend on the maximum log level set via setMaxLogLevel(LogLevel).

    The verbosity of the log levels is as follows: DEBUG > INFO > WARNINGS > ERRORS.

    Log messages may contain the name of the current thread and the calling class which makes debugging multithreaded applications easier.

      • setMaxLogLevel

        public static void setMaxLogLevel​(LogLevel ll)
        Set the maximum LogLevel.

        Default: DEBUG

        Parameters:
        ll - The new maximum loglevel.

      • setPrintStreams

        public static void setPrintStreams​(PrintStream out,
                                   PrintStream err,
                                   boolean colorsupport)
        Set where log messages should be outputted to.

        Use this function if you want to write to a log file instead of the output.

        Parameters:
        out - Where INFO messages should be printed to. Default: System.out
        err - Where other messages should be printed to. Default: System.err
        colorsupport - Whether the messages should be colored. Often unwanted when writing to log files. Default: true
